typeSystemDescription.name: BaseTypeSystem
typeSystemDescription.description: Establish the basic information extraction system that center on Events and Entities

featureDescription.name: argumentLinks
featureDescription.description: link between this argument and the event mention

featureDescription.name: headAnnotation
featureDescription.description: used to hold ACE head value, which could be multiple words

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.EventMentionRelation
typeDescription.description: Relation between event mentions, such as subevent, after. As a convention, coreference is normally annotated as a group, instead of relation links.

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.EventRelation
typeDescription.description: Relation between event, such as subevent, after. As a convention, coreference is normally annotated as a group, instead of relation links.

featureDescription.name: sourceMentionRelation
featureDescription.description: An entity relation can come from a mention relation.

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.EntityMentionRelation
typeDescription.description: Relation between entities, such as part-whole.

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.EntityRelation
typeDescription.description: Relation between entitiy mentions, such as part-whole.

featureDescription.name: sourceMentionRelation
featureDescription.description: An entity relation can come from a mention relation.

featureDescription.name: morpha
featureDescription.description: Unifying the morphological type and change it into a more based form

featureDescription.name: quantity
featureDescription.description: The associated quantity of this annotation

featureDescription.name: goldStandardEventMentionId
featureDescription.description: This feature stores only event mention IDs in the gold standard.

featureDescription.name: eventMentionIndex
featureDescription.description: This feature stores the sequential event mention index.

featureDescription.name: quantity
featureDescription.description: The NumberAnnotation indicate the quantity of the event mention, such as "three blasts", the quantity is "three", normalized as 3

featureDescription.name: arguments
featureDescription.description: The argument list of this event mention

featureDescription.name: mentionContext
featureDescription.description: The full event mention context

featureDescription.name: referringEvent
featureDescription.description: The underlying event referring to

featureDescription.name: frameName
featureDescription.description: The frame name an event evoke (it is still questionable whether we should put this attribute here)

featureDescription.name: goalLinks
featureDescription.description: Link to the goal of this event

featureDescription.name: mentionTokens
featureDescription.description: subtokens of this mention, which might be discontinous

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.PairwiseEventCoreferenceEvaluation
typeDescription.description: The type storing the information on event coreference.

featureDescription.name: eventCoreferenceRelationGoldStandard
featureDescription.description: Its value can be one of full, member, subevent, and no.

featureDescription.name: eventCoreferenceRelationSystem
featureDescription.description: Its value can be one of full, member, subevent, and no.

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: Confidence score for pairwise decision from the system

featureDescription.name: featureType
featureDescription.description: This can take two values now: 1. numeric 2. binary

featureDescription.name: defaultZero
featureDescription.description: Indicating the default value of this feature is 0

featureDescription.name: longitudePosition
featureDescription.description: East or west

featureDescription.name: latitudePosition
featureDescription.description: North or south

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.NumberAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Annotate numbers and their normalized form

featureDescription.name: normalizedString
featureDescription.description: The normalized result

featureDescription.name: featureType
featureDescription.description: This can take two values now: 1. numeric 2. binary

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.Entity
typeDescription.description: An entity refers to an underlying entity, it might corresponding to multiple entity mentions. It can be viewed that we assign the attributes to each cluster

featureDescription.name: entitySubtype
featureDescription.description: This feature corresponds to the ACE corpus annotation

featureDescription.name: entityClass
featureDescription.description: This feature corresponds to the ACE corpus annotation, see http://www.itl.nist.gov/iad/mig/tests/ace/2005/doc/ace05-evalplan.v2a.pdf

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.Event
typeDescription.description: An abstract annotation for event, which is a generalized concept that contains event mentions. It could be seen as we assign some attributes to the event mention clusters.

featureDescription.name: eventType
featureDescription.description: Event type

featureDescription.name: eventSubtype
featureDescription.description: Event subtype

featureDescription.name: polarity
featureDescription.description: Polarity annotation for ACE

featureDescription.name: arguments
featureDescription.description: Arguments of the event, annotated from the ace golden standard

featureDescription.name: isEmpty
featureDescription.description: show that this event is dummy and empty, not used to store event mentions, which is used only as a placeholder

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.EventMentionArgumentLink
typeDescription.description: Link between an event mention to its argument (which is an entity mention)

featureDescription.name: verbNetRoleName
featureDescription.description: The thematic role name in VerbNet

featureDescription.name: frameElementName
featureDescription.description: The frame element name in frame net

featureDescription.name: propbankRoleName
featureDescription.description: Argument role name in terms of PropBank

featureDescription.name: argumentRole
featureDescription.description: If you don't know what kind of argument it is, use this one, otherwise use one of the specific role name such as : "verbNet" "frameElement" or "probank".

featureDescription.name: superFrameElementRoleNames
featureDescription.description: store the super frame element names based on the frame relation table, current format "frameRelationType#superFrameName#superFEname"

featureDescription.name: argument
featureDescription.description: The argument attached to this link, represented as an Entity.

featureDescription.name: verbPreposition
featureDescription.description: The preposition that used to link this argument, for example " put on the clothes", "on" is the preposition to link to the actual argument "clothes".

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.EventMentionContext
typeDescription.description: The full context of the event mention

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.Script
typeDescription.description: Intend to be use for script based analysis. Still tentative

featureDescription.name: subevents
featureDescription.description: List of subevents in the script

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.ScriptSpan
typeDescription.description: A span that usually a script would occur in.

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.Dependency
typeDescription.description: A generic dependency type, specific annotator dependency should inherite this. In principle, dependency nodes can be different as words, that's why it was annotated individually.

featureDescription.name: verbNetRoleName
featureDescription.description: The thematic role name in VerbNet

featureDescription.name: frameElementName
featureDescription.description: The frame element name in frame net

featureDescription.name: propbankRoleName
featureDescription.description: Argument role name in terms of PropBank

featureDescription.name: superFrameElementRoleNames
featureDescription.description: store the super frame element names based on the frame relation table, current format "frameRelationType#superFrameName#superFEname"

featureDescription.name: verbPreposition
featureDescription.description: The preposition that used to link this argument, for example " put on the clothes", "on" is the preposition to link to the actual argument "clothes".

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.GoalMention
typeDescription.description: annotate a goal mention in text, of a certain event mention. For example, "He work hard to get higher grade.", the mention "get higher grade" is the goal.

featureDescription.name: head
featureDescription.description: Head word of this goal

featureDescription.name: phraseQuote
featureDescription.description: Whether this is a quoted phrase (otherwise whole sentence).

featureDescription.name: sense
featureDescription.description: The wordnet sense of the entity.

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.FrameTrigger
typeDescription.description: represent the trigger word of the frame.

featureDescription.name: arguments
featureDescription.description: the list of arguments of this trigger.

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.cs.lti.script.type.FrameArgument
typeDescription.description: represent the argument of a frame.

featureDescription.name: trigger
featureDescription.description: the associated trigger of this argument.

featureDescription.name: verbNetRoleName
featureDescription.description: The thematic role name in VerbNet

featureDescription.name: frameElementName
featureDescription.description: The frame element name in frame net

featureDescription.name: propbankRoleName
featureDescription.description: Argument role name in terms of PropBank

featureDescription.name: argumentRole
featureDescription.description: If you don't know what kind of argument it is, use this one, otherwise use one of the specific role name such as : "verbNet" "frameElement" or "probank".

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: Some sort of confidence score for this argument.

featureDescription.name: superFrameElementRoleNames
featureDescription.description: store the super frame element names based on the frame relation table, current format "frameRelationType#superFrameName#superFEname"

featureDescription.name: argument
featureDescription.description: The argument attached to this link, represented as an Entity

featureDescription.name: verbPreposition
featureDescription.description: The preposition that used to link this argument, for example " put on the clothes", "on" is the preposition to link to the actual argument "clothes"
